result.content:
Before we get our hands on coding, We will use C++ language and there is a structure for every language that we need to follow.

Simple structure of c++ code:-

#include < library_name >

int main()
{

  //some code 

}

Let's go step by step and see and how it is executed.

Firstly we know that computers only understand 0's and 1's so to let the computer understands what we want to do there is

something called compiler which translates our code into computer language.

In C++ the compiler search for main() then starts compiling the code line by line from the first curly bracket '{' to its corresponding one '}'

So now its obvious that the main code is written inside main()

Now what about "#include < library_name >" ?

There are libraries that contain written code to use it without rewriting it.

And the above line tells the compiler that this library will be used in this program.

Lets try to say hello using c++ code

cout<< " Hello how old are you?! ";

To print something on console we use cout which is defined in iostream library.it prints anything you between the double quotes " "

Now the user wants to tell us his age and interact with our program

to do that we need to receive the input from the user and save it somewhere

Here comes cin which inserts the input that the user entered into data carriers called "Variables"

So what are Variables ?

A place reserved in the memory that carry the data we want and we can use it to do operations on.

Each variable has an address and value

Ex: X =4; Y= 16;

Since we have different kinds of data, we need different kinds of variables to store it.

Different data types have different sizes in memory.

Examples:-

  • int Only integers
  • long long Only integers
  • float Decimals and integers
  • double Decimals and integers
  • char Symbols
  • bool True/False

Examples:-

int X=15235;
long long X=1235145123511;
double X=3.0140123124121;
float X=4.5263;
char z='a';
bool X=true;           //X=true;
bool X=false;          //X=false;
bool X=1;              //X=true;
bool X=0;              //X=false;
bool X=1235125;        //X=true;

The most known ranges are for int And long long where is the int ranges from -(2^31)-1 to +(2^31)-1

and long long ranges from -(2^63)-1 to +(2^63)-1.

Now that we have his age lets play a little

Can you know his birth year ?

so we need a variable to hold birth year(answer),and one for his age and let the magic begin WHOOOSH!
